H0.text: What traditional dark ale is said to derive from its consumption by early 1700s doormen and bag-carrying street workers. Stout

H1.text: What traditional dark ale is said to derive from its consumption by early 1700s doormen and bag-carrying street workers. Mild Ale

H2.text: What traditional dark ale is said to derive from its consumption by early 1700s doormen and bag-carrying street workers. Brown Ale

H3.text: What traditional dark ale is said to derive from its consumption by early 1700s doormen and bag-carrying street workers. Porter

A4.text: The name is believed to have originated from its popularity with porters.

A5.text: Porter was first mentioned in 1721, as a development of the brown beer already being produced across London, and delivered to publicans to age and blend to their customers' tastes;
